name: Humboldt Penguin
description: It has an elongated body suited for swimming, paddle-like wings, and webbed feet shifted backward. The Humboldt Penguin features a continuous black band from the sides across the chest and a white throat with a white stripe extending above the eye.
spread_note: Western coast of South America and adjacent Pacific Ocean
image_alt: Humboldt Penguin, photo: Prague Zoo Archive
proportions: Body length 65–67 cm, tail length 2–3.5 cm, weight 3.5–6 kg
attractions: Penguins are superbly adapted to life in water. The Humboldt Penguin, a heat-tolerant species, extends its range near the equator despite being a southern hemisphere bird.
breeding: Prague Zoo has kept Humboldt Penguins since the early 1960s and is among Europe’s successful breeders, having raised over 100 chicks.
